ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 12
ygData.msgSnippet: As long as i am on the list then anyone who says you dont belong can kiss my skinny ass -joe
ygData.messageBody:
As long as i am on the list then anyone who says you dont belong can kiss
my skinny ass

-joe

On Thu, 22 Jul 1999, Lora Roa wrote:

> From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
>
> Hello! With the new server and possible gatherings I thought I'd
> introduce.
>
> About the only thing that may take more guts than admitting your gay on
> a straight list is admitting your straight on a gay list. I am a straight,
> however, (no I'm not about to say "but I have a gay friend" pppt!) ... I was
> raised by two gay males after my father died when I was quite young.
> Actually,
> since he was bedridden when I was a toddler, they had stepped into that role
> starting when I was 2-3 years old. There were two other couples who also
> helped, known as four more "Uncles" to me. So they were my functional father
> figures as long as I can rememeber, also called "Uncles". I followed in the
> professional footsteps of one (and he helped put me through college), and my
> main hobby follows the heart and profession of the other. So "I was raised
> by gays, but I'm straight" *is* an uncomfortable thing to say in the straight
> community. Why do they peer at you and go "Are you sure?"? (grrr)
> Fortunately
> most aquaintences never questioned why I had eight "Uncles", and only two
> were
> related (my mother does have two brothers). :) Anyway, that's why I joined
> the
> list. Its as much "home" for me as any other group mailing list.
>
> I've got characters on Erollisi & just strarted on Brell. I've RPed a bit and
> my characters are often different and some are a bit goofy, some are
> goody-two-
> shoes, some are dark and evil (cackles!). If I'm not "egged" or "rotten
> tomatoed",
> I'll put up the list .. I'd love to find others to group with.
>
> - Lora
>
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
> Congratulations SAYNO2DRUGS. Our latest ONElist of the week.
> http://www.onelist.com
> How is ONElist changing YOUR life? Visit our homepage and let us know!
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
